revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse of September 13, 1699
tldr: Dr. David Gregory observed the solar eclipse of September 13, 1699, and recorded the phases of the eclipse. He noted that the eclipse ended precisely 24 minutes and 9 seconds after 10 am. Gregory also mentioned that the greatest observation, which was 10 digits and a quarter, occurred 7 minutes after 9 am. The provided scheme shows the rest of the eclipse phases.
